title: Bush Sr Regulatory Capture Consolidation and S&L Crisis Exploitation (1989-1993)
description: Research Bush Sr administration's consolidation of Reagan-era regulatory capture through Savings & Loan crisis exploitation. Document systematic weakening of financial oversight, appointment of industry insiders to regulatory positions, and establishment of 'too big to fail' precedents. Focus on how S&L crisis was exploited to justify further deregulation and taxpayer bailouts that became template for 2008 financial crisis response.
constitutional_issues: democratic accountability erosion through crisis exploitation
public interest subordination to industry capture
